intro: Sericocomopsis pallida var. grandis, commonly known as the pale sericocomopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
